commands.description: set the number of seconds to wait before killing idle connections
commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku redis:timeout [DATABASE] [34m[flags][39m

[1mset the number of seconds to wait before killing idle connections[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP          [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE    [2mgit remote of app to use[22m
 -s, --seconds SECONDS  [2mset timeout value[22m

Sets the number of seconds to wait before killing idle connections. A value of zero means that connections will not be closed.
helpLine: [2mset the number of seconds to wait before killing idle connections[22m

commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku redis:maxmemory [DATABASE] [34m[flags][39m

[1mset the key eviction policy[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -p, --policy POLICY  [2mset policy name[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m

Set the key eviction policy when instance reaches its storage limit. Available policies for key eviction include:

    noeviction      # returns errors when memory limit is reached
    allkeys-lru     # removes less recently used keys first
    volatile-lru    # removes less recently used keys first that have an expiry set
    allkeys-random  # evicts random keys
    volatile-random # evicts random keys but only those that have an expiry set
    volatile-ttl    # only evicts keys with an expiry set and a short TTL

[1mUsage:[22m heroku redis:maintenance [DATABASE] [34m[flags][39m

[1mmanage maintenance windows[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -f, --force          [2mstart maintenance without entering application maintenance mode[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m
 -w, --window WINDOW  [2mset weekly UTC maintenance window[22m
 --run                [2mstart maintenance[22m

Set or change the maintenance window for your Redis instance
